p: There are four clinical classifications of patients according to Diagnosis and Treatment Protocol for Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia (Trial Version 6) that was released by the National Health Commission & State Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine; mild, moderate, severe and critical. Patients in the mild group have mild symptoms with no radiologic findings of pneumonia. Those in the moderate group show fever, and respiratory symptoms, with radiological findings of pneumonia. Severe cases showing any of these criteria: respiratory distress (respiratory rate ≥ 30/min), hypoxemia (blood oxygen saturation ≤ 93%), and lung infiltrates progression > 50% within 24–48 h. Critical cases meeting any of the following criteria: Respiratory failure and requiring mechanical ventilation, shock, with other organ failure that requires intensive care unit (ICU) care [ 27]. If the disease progresses, the median duration period from illness onset to dyspnea is 8.0 days, and to mechanical ventilation is 10.5 days [ 4].
